meanings.definition: The properties or qualities of a room or building that determine how sound is transmitted within it.
meanings.sent1: The acoustics of the concert hall made the music sound clear and vibrant.
meanings.sent2: The acoustics in the classroom were so poor that it was hard to hear the teacher.
meanings.sent3: The acoustics of the bathroom amplified his singing, much to the amusement of his family.
meanings.sent4: The acoustics of the cave whispered secrets back to the explorers.
meanings.sent5: The acoustics of the stadium were so amazing that even the quietest whisper could be heard across the field.

meanings.definition: The branch of physics concerned with the properties of sound.
meanings.sent1: Studying acoustics helps scientists understand how sound waves travel through different mediums.
meanings.sent2: The professor specialized in acoustics and conducted research on sound propagation.
meanings.sent3: In the world of acoustics, even the smallest vibrations can lead to big discoveries.
meanings.sent4: The acoustics of the ocean depths are a mysterious realm waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: Acoustics is like a puzzle where each piece represents a different aspect of sound behavior.
